title: Jorge Thomas
text:
‚ÄúHello there‚Äù
Hi, I‚Äôm Jorge and I like espresso made with light roast beans. I subscribe to Johnny Cash‚Äôs definition of paradise:
‚ÄúThis morning, with her, having coffee.‚Äù
Professionally I am an Electrical Engineer fond of sustainable energy sources, in consequence data and modelling. Somehow, I‚Äôve always manage to end up doing what I love the most: the development of data-driven algorithms either for supporting control systems or providing business intelligence.
I live in Karlsruhe. If you want to know how I got into what today is Data Science click on the ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù tab. If you want to talk about data science, music or coffee instead, just drop me an email.
Have a nice day or night.
J. Thomas

title: Projects
text:
Machine Learning

Advanced Regression Techniques with Visual Analytics
In this classic Kaggle project you can follow my workflow where I‚Äôll give you some tips along the way, developing pipelines on the ETL phase of the DS cycle, as well as a tidy approach on the exploratory data analysis substantialy supported on visual analytics.

title: Projects
text:
Deep Learning
It is known that the most common type of dataset found in the industry is the tabular one. In this regard ML‚Äôs non-parametric methods with ensembling via bagging or boosting are king.
However, for datasets with high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) like image recognition and language translation, DL methods are the best.

title: Projects
text:
Data Visualisation

E2E Dashboards with Tableau
Click here to see the dashboards on the Tableau Public website.

title: Projects
text:
Machine Learning:

Hierarchical clustering of daily load profiles
In the modern world of sector-coupled utilities, i.e., gas, water, heat & power distribution, time-series always follow a very strong daily seasonality. Load and demand sequential data are a strong function of calendar facotors like hour and day type. Based on a famous proceeding with more than forty citations in patents, I developed this heriarchical clustering algorithm as a tool to identify the most relevant daily patterns, e.g., weekends, holidays, workdays and anomalous profiles.

title: Projects

Survival Analysis
My professional entry point to what at that time was Data Mining, specifically in the area of reliability and risk assessment of power networks.

title: Projects
text:
Interactive Dashboards

Using Tableau for IoT-Dashboard and Energy Management
I designed these IoT-Dashboards with monitoring and BI purposes using Tableau Desktop. I also developed the whole E2E pipeline using technolgies like InfluxDB, SQLite, Python and Tableau Bridge to keep the dashboards up to date on a half-hour basis. This was the final part of the project ‚ÄúEnergiemanager zur angebots- und bedarfsgerechten Zuschaltung von Energietr√§gern‚Äù, dynOpt-En.
Moreover, I developed the core forecasting algorithm for the predictive control of the energy manager.
